intro: Bigelowia intricata, commonly known as the intricate bigelowia, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and alpine regions. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
